messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Allergies, food, and behavior, was Re: mindful parenting
messages.msgSnippet: Kimmee - It s based upon kinesiology - muscle testing - You know if you hold out your arm straight and then someone pushes it you can still hold it up.  But if
messages.messageBody:
Kimmee - It's based upon kinesiology - muscle testing - You know if you hold out your arm straight and then someone pushes it you can still hold it up. But if you hold something which causes problems for you, the "blockage" will weaken you, and you will not be able to push to hold up your arm. This is the kind of electrical imbalance that essential oils, Bach's flower essences and DNR's body soaks work on too, I believe. For more info on NAET, look at these sites:

http://www.naet.com
http://www.drellencutler.com Dr. Cutler's treatment emcompasses NAET and other supplemental measures.

Annette
----- Original Message -----
From: squeaksoup@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, May 10, 2001 6:33 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Allergies, food, and behavior, was Re: mindful parenting



In a message dated 5/10/01 10:52:29, diamondair@... writes:

<< A couple of useless rounds with a pediatric
allergist later and we stumbled on to NAET (Nambudriped's Allergy
Elimination Technique). >>

Could you tell us more about this? I've never heard of it. I have a son who
probably has multiple allergies although we have to discern what they are.
Kimme

messages.subject: Allergies, food, and behavior, was Re: mindful parenting
messages.msgSnippet: ... Lynda, our experience has been very similar. We found that dairy and wheat were big culprits here (our son has SID - that s sensory integration
messages.messageBody:
> From: "Lynda" <lurine@...>
> Once we started looking at things from the diet end of the spectrum and
> about teaching the kidlets to be aware of what was happening with their
> bodies, how they could be in control, what a weight was lifted.

Lynda, our experience has been very similar. We found that dairy and wheat
were big culprits here (our son has SID - that's sensory integration
dysfunction, for those not used to the acronym), and then when we removed
wheat and dairy from his diet it exposed a host of other food allergies we
had no idea were there. A couple of useless rounds with a pediatric
allergist later and we stumbled on to NAET (Nambudriped's Allergy
Elimination Technique). Since starting that, we've begun eliminating our
son's food allergies completely and the most of the behavioral and sensory
issues just went away and we don't have to deal with the restrictive diets
anymore, very nice!

Blue Skies!
-Robin-
Mom to Mackenzie (8/28/96) inventer of new and wonderful things
and Asa (10/5/99) singer of protest songs
